name: Mystery Springs Canyon
description:
Introduction

A short side entrance canyon of Mystery Springs Canyon in the Sierra Ancha Mountains. It's not a destination canyon but rather a beginner-friendly one for someone who has a capable 4x4 and 2 hours to kill after doing Parker Canyon. Similar to Phog Canyon but with more prickly pear cactus and a less friendly exit.

Approach

An easy 15-minute walk across a couple of hills and a barbed wire fence. The first drainage you cross is Mystery Springs Canyon proper which has just one rappel of about 100 ft. It could be fun with some flow.

Descent

Once in the drainage, rappel 1 is 20 feet on canyon left from webbing around a horn. There is minor bushwhacking to rappel 2 which is 10 feet down a narrow hallway. The anchor is webbing around a small bush and rock. Rappel 3 is 70 feet from webbing off a tree on canyon right.

Exit

After the third rappel, the exit is on canyon right up an obvious slope across from the waterfall. Make your way up and right around the manzanita, catclaw, and many prickly pear working the slope on the left side of the rock fall

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media
